result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Gray

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy Gray appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Timothy Gray.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a competency hearing.  Sworn for the State: Doctor Jenna Goebel (Examining Psychologist).  Closing arguments heard.  Court adopts the Doctor's findings and orders continued commitment with WRC.  Case adjourned for a Doctor's Report Return in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Gray not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Timothy Gray.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report.   Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Signed, Order of Commitment for Treatment

Defendant Timothy Gray in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Timothy Gray in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Sworn for the State: Dr. Goebel. Testimony closed. Statements by parties.  Court finds that the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Timothy Gray not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense cousnel appears via Zoom. Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Defendant refuses to appear. Statements by defense counsel that defendant challenges the report. Court orders case adjourned for contested hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Timothy Gray not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Timothy Gray in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Timothy Gray in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy Gray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
